metadata.synopsis: The player must pick between siding with Voss and helping Orpheus or siding with Vlaakith's Inquisitor in killing Orpheus. Laezel is predisposed to a certain faction depending on the outcome of the Creche, but can be convinced by the player to swing to the other faction. A fight results with the opposing party and Laezel can leave the party and be hostile if not convinced to side with the Player's decision.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go to bed in the Intermezzo Camp when you arrive. Plays automatically after the VossAmbush scene if Laezel is a Companion, either in the party, or left in camp.|

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: Supreme Kith'rak. Have you come to slay me with your own silver?

151.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
151.text: I've not come to kill you, Lae'zel. I've come to free you.

129.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
129.text: I've not come to kill you, child. I've come to free you.

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: Tl'a'vlaakith - I will not be bound my flame, rider!

6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
6.text: Such informality, child. Does Jhe'stil Kith'rak not command your respect?
6.context: NodeContext: zhe-STILL KITH-rack. Supreme Knight. Fatherly, but not antagonsistically like before.

121.speaker: Lae'zel
121.text: Your flame speaks for you, kith'rak. You've come for blood.

114.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
114.text: Your blood? No, child. I've come for your aid.

100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss kneels and lays his sword on the ground in the githyanki sign of submission.

132.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
132.text: Ska'kek kir Gith shabell'eth. My blade rests. Mother Gith compels you to listen.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: You've trapped us in flame. Why in the Hells should I listen to you?

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Your cronies tried to kill us. Why should Lae'zel listen to you?

138.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
138.text: Because I know the truth of your relic. It holds the very heart and soul of our people.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: You might have killed us before. Why should Lae'zel listen to you?

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Fine. We'll hear what you have to say before we gut you.

140.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
140.text: Your ear is all I ask. But I will take your head if I must.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Nod to Lae'zel. She should take the lead.

149.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
149.text: I know of the relic you carry, child - and I know its truth. It holds the very heart and soul of our people.

63.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
63.text: The relic you carry, the one Vlaakith hunts. I know its truth. The heart of my people beats within it.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: Orpheus. Impossible. The traitor is dead.

142.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
142.text: Prince Orpheus lives. And it is his prison you carry.

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *Orpheus, a name of legend. The son of Gith, the first leader of your people, executed by exalted Queen Vlaakith - or so you were taught.*

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I've been inside. There was no githyanki prince there.

15.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
15.text: Then you've been blinded to Orpheus' light.

19.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
19.text: Child. You are a slave. Chained, bound, and beaten by the Queen of Lies.

20.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
20.text: Vlaakith does not love you. There is no ascension, no purification. You are cattle, you are chaff - to be harvested and devoured.

57.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
57.text: Mother Gith did not tear off our shackles for our flesh to feed a new master!

12.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
12.text: But her son lives, child. He lives! The flame of our freedom, burning in your hand. Together -

31.context: CinematicNodeContext: A portal opens and a few Githyanki, including Vlaakith's Hand, name of Fahra, exit out of it and move to surround the party.

34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss grabs his sword and rises to his feet

126.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
126.text: Voss. My Queen serves you feast and favour - and you repay her with treason.

125.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
125.text: Do not dare speak my name!

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *You recall this name: 'Fahra'. No mere warrior or even kith'rak, but Vlaakith's Hand - enforcer of your Queen's will.*

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: |A githyanki prince? Is this why the mother superior seeks this relic?|

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Who in the hells are you?

16.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
16.context: NodeContext: Addressed to Voss. Almost frothing.

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.text: 'Fahra'. Vlaakith's Hand, her Eyes, her Voice.

3.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
3.text: And more. I am Vlaakith's eyes in darkness, her ears in chaos. I am law. I am judgement!
3.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, increasingly deranged.

84.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
84.text: Lae'zel. The pride of Crèche K'liir.
84.context: NodeContext: Addressed to Lae'zel, suddenly calm.

136.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
136.text: I know you. Your Queen knows you. You are ice, you are brimstone, stained with your kin's blood.

45.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
45.text: And yet Vlaakith prepares you a place at her table.

87.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
87.text: Her word is your duty, her will is your honour. Strike down the kith'rak, deliver the relic - and claim your seat at our Queen's side. Be ascended!

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *Lae'zel's loyalty to Vlaakith burns her mind - and yours. She means to strike Kith'rak Voss.*
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld between Lae'zel and player, but no need to show anyone's hands go to their heads, just the VFX is fine.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Abandon Vlaakith, Lae'zel. Cut Fahra down.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: No. I will not turn on my Queen!
41.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, but uncertain despite her words.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I heard truth in the kith'rak's words. I trust him, and so should you.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You mean nothing to Vlaakith. Reject her, and seek the truth.

130.speaker: Lae'zel
130.text: Truth. So tainted by death and deceit that I'd forgotten its taste.
130.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player, but more a musing to herself. She has come to see the player's point of view.

146.speaker: Lae'zel
146.text: 'Live, but only if you live free' - Gith's plea to us all. I will know my prince. This is my path.

61.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
61.text: K'chakhi! I name you hshar'lak - traitor to your people. It is written!
61.context: NodeContext: ke-CHOCK-ee / h-SHAR-lack (Idiot/Traitor) Addressed to Lae'zel

13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fahra lunges towards Voss and tries to attack, but she misses.

111.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fahra weaves a psionic spell and casts it on Voss's dragon, making it fight for her.NodeContext: cue-DAY-nos CHEER-key. Che-MAR ZAL-la VLAH-kith!

143.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dragon rears up and roars at the party.

29.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prepares to attack.NodeContext: Addressed to the dragon. cue-DAY-nos.

53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fahra lunges towards Voss and attacks. Wounded, he falls to the ground.

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel calling out after Farah strikes Voss down

152.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fahra weaves a psionic spell and casts it on Voss's dragon, making it fight for her.NodeContext: cue-DAY-nos CHEER-key. Che-MAR ZAL-la VLAH-kith!

58.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dragon rears up and roars at the party.

68.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prepares to attack.NodeContext: Addressed to the dragon. cue-DAY-nos.

144.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
144.text: So it is written! To arms, Lae'zel. Let the traitors taste blood and silver!

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Gith's spirit lives on in her son. He deserves your allegiance.

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: My eyes were open, and I refused to see. My ears heard, and still I turned away. But I will be slave no more.

128.speaker: Lae'zel
128.text: I know my allegiance. It is to my Queen!

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Very well. Remain loyal to Vlaakith, and bear the consequences.

113.speaker: Lae'zel
113.text: Vlaakith is my path. Ascension is my fate!

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: You. I lend you my might, my very essence, and you thwart my will at every turn!

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: My queen calls. I am prepared to answer.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: My eyes were open, and I refused to see. My ears heard, and still I turned away. But I will be slave no more.
85.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player. Increasingly intense.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: You are a servant of Vlaakith. Killing Voss is the only way forward.

137.speaker: Lae'zel
137.text: Pitiful kith'rak. Your lies sting like acid and burn like flame. I name you hshar'lak - traitor!

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: Have you already forgotten? Did my own Queen not turn her back?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: The Absolute's army marches. We need Vlaakith on our side.

102.speaker: Lae'zel
102.text: Yes. Yes! 'Beware the lies of false prophets.' So said the exalted Queen. And so I will heed!

47.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
47.text: Lae'zel. You will not be our ruin. Orpheus will rise. The githyanki will be free.
47.context: NodeContext: Addressed to Lae'zel. Sad but determined.

21.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Preparing to fight.NodeContext: Called out to the dragon, preparing to fight.

97.speaker: Lae'zel
97.text: No. I will be slave no longer!

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: 'Live, but only if you live free' - Gith's plea to us all. I will know my prince. This is my path.

70.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
70.text: K'chakhi! I name you hshar'lak - traitor to your people. It is written!
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Preparing to fightNodeContext: ke-CHOCK-ee / h-SHAR-lack (Idiot/Traitor) Addressed to Lae'zel

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Gith made your people free. But it was Vlaakith who made them mighty.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: Yes. Yes! I will be pure. I will ascend. I will wield silver!

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Fool! Reject Orpheus, or I will present your head to Vlaakith myself.

131.speaker: Lae'zel
131.text: I see it - your great will, your great strength, a gift from Vlaakith herself.

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: I am Gith's child. I bend to Vlaakith no longer.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Renounce Vlaakith if you must, then. But be prepared for the consequences.

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: Then I turn to the True Heir.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Do as you will, Lae'zel. I won't stand in your way.

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *Lae'zel's loyalty wavers. You feel her confusion, her uncertainty - and a nascent longing for freedom.*
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld between Lae'zel and player, but no need to show anyone's hands go to their heads, just the VFX is fine.

119.speaker: a4df3a1d-0c32-4548-acfe-5e45b1886671
119.text: I know you. Your Queen knows you. A nova among stars.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: That doesn't explain why you came for our heads.

75.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
75.text: I knew not then what I know now. Let the truth be my atonement.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I thought the artefact was a weapon.

76.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
76.text: And so it is. It holds the true heir, it holds insurrection - a blade to be held against Vlaakith's withered throat.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Tell me more of this Orpheus.

50.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
50.text: Son of Gith, our great mother. Vlaakith calls him traitor. I call him saviour.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Orpheus - Gith's son. I thought he was long dead.

25.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
25.text: A myth, recorded to slate, fed to us like devils to dragons.
